title: Stocks to Watch: Hexo, Caledonia Mining, ConocoPhillips, General Motors, Boeing
text:
By James Willhite

Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Monday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

Hexo: The cannabis producer's stock dropped 38% last week amid mounting skepticism about the sector's prospects.

Caledonia Mining : The miner said Monday that third-quarter gold production rose 7.3% compared with the second quarter, below its target.

ConocoPhillips : The energy company has agreed to sell its operations in northern Australia to Santos for $1.39 billion.

General Motors : United Auto Workers is increasing its weekly payout to GM workers on strike, a sign the union is preparing to extend a nearly monthly walkout that has halted work at the company's U.S. factories.

Boeing : The aerospace firm Friday stripped Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg of his dual role as chairman, in an unexpected shake-up amid the prolonged crisis of its 737 MAX plane.
